Sequence Information.Peptide Name: M4R (Myxinidin 4R, Arg-rich; synthetic AMPs, XXA, UCLL1c)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (76.92%) toMyxinidin 3KR: 33%; G=I: 17%.Activity: active against E. coli ATCC 11219 (MIC 3 uM), P. aeruginosa ATCC 13388 (MIC 20 uM), S. enterica serovar Typhimurium ATCC 14028 (MIC 10 uM), K. pneumoniae ATCC 10031 (MIC 5 uM), S. aureus ATCC 6538 (MIC 10 uM).Toxicity: human RBC (5%), 7% hemolysis at 200 uM (HC50> 200 uM, low hemo.lytic).Structure: helical in 50% TFE.
Literature Information.Author: Cantisani M, Leone M, Mignogna E, Kampanaraki K, Falanga A, Morelli G, Galdiero M, Galdiero S.2013
Literature Information.Title: Structure-activity relations of myxinidin, an antibacterial peptide derived from the epidermal mucus of hagfish.
